pages.text: Little is known about existing modifiers. Evidence suggests they can affect both the target and effect of runes, $(o)in some cases inverting them entirely$(). More research is required.$(br)$(br)Several pages have been left blank; you are encouraged to make notes of your own investigations.

$(l)Tunneling Rune$()$(br)$(br)Tunneling runes can sometimes focus the effect of in-world runic arrays, causing them to affect the block beyond whatever they're attached to. In other contexts, they may cause effects to pass through targets.
$(l)Invert Rune$()$(br)$(br)Invert runes reverse the effect of most runic arrays.
$(l)Widen Rune$()$(br)$(br)Widen runes can dramatically extend the range of runic arrays. Note: this doesn't work with collision runes or ward runes, as those require physical contact.
$(l)Narrow Rune$()$(br)$(br)Narrow runes can dramatically contract the range of runic arrays. Note: this doesn't work with collision runes or ward runes, as those require physical contact.
$(l)Time Rune$()$(br)$(br)Time runes cause runic energies to focus more quickly, shortening the time between runic effects.
